Class ByteArrayUtils

public class ByteArrayUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility methods for writing to a byte array

Version:
1.0
Author:
Raj Patel

Method Summary

writeFixedString

public static void writeFixedString(byte[] dest,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    int offset,
                                    int fixedSize)
Creates a fixed size byte array, populates it with contents of a String and writes this to a destination byte array

Parameters:
dest - the destination byte array
value - the String value
offset - the offset to write to in the destination array
fixedSize - the size of the byte array to place the String into

value - the short value to be written
offset - the offset to write to in the destination array

Write an integer to a byte array

getFixedSizeBytes

public static byte[] getFixedSizeBytes(int fixedSize,
                                       java.lang.String value)
Get a fixed size byte array populated with the contents of a String If the String length is larger than the byte array, the String will be truncated to the fixed size

Parameters:
fixedSize - the size of the byte array to place the String into
value - the String value
Returns:
the populated byte array
